course_main_structural_unit.address:
Riia 23b, ruumid 123-127, 135, 220, 227
51010 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The course will develop basic knowledge and skills in cell biology and introduce the methodology used to study cell structure and function. 
Key topics: Organization of a cell. Different cell types. Specific visualization methods for different cell types and organelles. Microscopy. Flow cytometry. Subcellular structures. Mitosis, meiosis, cell cycle, apoptosis.
description.et:
Üliõpilased omandavad praktilise laboratoorse töö kogemusi. Töötamine inimese ja loomarakkude koekultuuridega, rakkude fikseerimine ja värvimine, immuunrekatsioonid rakupreparaatidel ning läbivoolutsütofluorimeetria. 
Põhiteemad: Erinevad rakutüübid. Rakkude visualiseerimise meetodid. Mikroskoopia. Läbivoolutsütomeetria. Mitoos, meioos, rakutsükkel, apoptoos.

objectives.en: The aim of this subject is to introduce to students the main methods and technical equipment used in cell biology studies.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärgiks on tutvustada põhilisi rakubioloogias kasutatavaid uurimismeetodeid ja aparatuuri.

learning_outcomes.en:
During the practical course, students study the fundamentals of cell biology and the experimental approaches used to examine the cell and its function.
After the course, students know the correct procedures for microscopy, and to prepare simple cell microscopy slides, as well as have got general principles of flow cytometry and basic skills of cell culture techniques.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilased omandavad praktilise laboratoorse töö kogemusi. Töötamine inimese ja loomarakkude koekultuuridega, rakkude fikseerimine ja värvimine, immuunrekatsioonid rakupreparaatidel ning läbivoolutsütofluorimeetria.

grade_preconditions.et: Participation in all practical classes is compulsory in order to gain access to the exam.

debt_elimination.et: Repeat exam can be done in accordance with the UT Study Regulations.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
